text:
I have a problem when executing a script, the server get blocked and no have any
message of Time out or something. When it occurs i have to kill the processes
and restart the http server. 
The reason why i write the problem here is because in the Error Log File i don't
see anything relevant, the only i see is this: "rm" is not recognized like an
internal, external command or batch file.

Thanks
creator: cdiaz@fgc.net

text:
It sounds like you are running a script designed for unix on a windows system.

But in any case, we can't help with debugging scripts here.  Please take your
question to a user-support forum like the users@httpd.apache.org mailing list.

Thanks.
creator: slive@apache.org
cdiaz@fgc.net
text:
Hi,

I confirm that it's not a script problem, because the web server only gets 
blocked when the script is executed in the same server, i think it's something 
relative to a loopback connection.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Sorry, but this report doesn't provide any information for us to resolve an
apache bug, and your error message clearly indicates that there's a user
problem here.  issues.apache.org is -not- a support forum, follow Joshua's
advise.
